project.name: Cone.js
project.description: A little class to manage 3d cones in BabylonJS

Cone.name: Cone
Cone.description:
Manage 3d Cone with a simple API

Based on BabylonJS

props.name: name
props.description: Name of the cone instance

props.name: tessellation
props.description: Number of faces of the cylinder

props.name: moveStep
props.description: How much the cone will move at each move call

props.name: turnStep
props.description: How much the cone will turn at each turn call (in rad)

props.name: eyeSize
props.description: Eye size

props.name: color
props.description: Color of the cone's sylinder (default : #900000) - can be in RGB or HEXA

props.name: pickable
props.description: Defines if the cone is pickable

props.name: $customOption
props.description: Pass any custom option with a parameter's name starting by $

Cone.helpers.name: Cone.helpers
Cone.helpers.description:
Bunch of methods I didn't find inside BabylonJS, that I coded for myself.
 Please tell me if they exist

Cone.List.name: Cone.List
Cone.List.description:
Management of Cone instances lists made easier

Instance methods made available directly on the list, and lots of other things.

classitems.description: Original sizes
classitems.name: _size

classitems.description: x postion of the cone in the space
classitems.name: position.x

classitems.description: y postion of the cone in the space

classitems.description: z postion of the cone in the space

classitems.description: x rotation of the cone in the space
classitems.name: rotation.x

classitems.description: y rotation of the cone in the space

classitems.description: z rotation of the cone in the space

classitems.description: x scaling of the cone

classitems.description: y scaling of the cone
classitems.name: scaling.y

classitems.description: z scaling of the cone
classitems.name: scaling.z

classitems.description: Launches the next callback in the queue then removes it from the queue
classitems.name: dequeue

classitems.description:
* Call it only with the queueName : **Returns the queue**.
* Call it with queueName + callback : registers the callback in the queue. This
callback has a "next" parameter to launch the next callback in the queue. **Returns the cone to chain**.
* Call it with queueName + array of callback to replace the queue. **Returns the cone to chain**
classitems.name: queue

params.name: callback
params.description: use the next param like : `function(next, currentCone){ myCone.fadeOut().delay(1000).then(next); }`

classitems.description: Adds callback to the last used queue
classitems.name: then
example:
```js
var myCone = new Cone(scene);
myCone
  .fadeOut()
  .fadeIn()
  .delay(1000)
  .widenEyes()
  .unWidenEyes()
  .then(function(next){myCone.setColor('#900000'); next()})
  .bump();
```

classitems.description:
Delays the next event in the queue of "delay" ms.

You can force the queue name.

Can also be used without the `queueName` if you're alredy chaining on the right queue like : `myCone.fadeOut().delay(2000).fadeIn()`
classitems.name: delay

classitems.description: Clears the queue
classitems.name: clearQueue

classitems.description: Clears all the queues
classitems.name: clearQueues

classitems.description:
Stops all the animations on the fx queue then clears the queue
(all other queues continue)
classitems.name: flushAnimationQueue

classitems.description: Returns cone position
classitems.name: getPosition

classitems.description: Returns true if an fx animation is running
classitems.name: isAnimationRunning

classitems.description: Returns true if the cone is widenning eyes
classitems.name: isWidenningEyes

classitems.description: Returns true if the cone has its eyes widen
classitems.name: isEyesWiden

classitems.description: Returns true if alpha is animating on the cone
classitems.name: isChangingAlpha

classitems.description:
Checks if two cones intersect (based on the bottom diameter)

If a cone has been rescaled, it's taken account (although, if scaling x and z are different the bigger one is taken in account)
classitems.name: intersectsCone

params.name: replace
params.description: if you wan't not only to check the limit but also keep the cone inside it

classitems.description:
* Attaches this cone to the one passed in parameter
* If you try to tail a cone already followed by another, your cone will follow the last one in the tail
* Returns the cone you end up tailing
classitems.name: tail

props.name: distance
props.description: By default the sum of the radiuses of the cones

classitems.description: Detaches your cone, returns the cone it was tailing
classitems.name: unTail

classitems.description: Returns the cone this cone is tailing (or false if none)
classitems.name: tailingCone

classitems.description: Returns the cone this cone is tailed by (or false if none)
classitems.name: tailedCone

classitems.description: Returns true if this cone is n a tail in a way or an other
classitems.name: isTailRelated

classitems.description: Returns a Cone.List of the cones tailing this one
classitems.name: getFullTail

classitems.description: Registers the cone to a BABYLON.ShadowGenerator to be able to render shadows on the shadow map
classitems.name: registerToShadowGenerator

classitems.description:
Squints the eyes of one step
Returns true if the eyes are not all squinted
Returns false if they are and stop squint
classitems.name: squint

classitems.description:
Unsquints the eyes of one step
Returns true if the eyes are not all unsquinted
Returns false if they are and stop squint
classitems.name: unSquint

classitems.description:
Sets the color of the cylinder
Accepts hexa or rgb color
classitems.name: setColor

classitems.description: Sets the scale on all the cone
classitems.name: setScale

classitems.description: Sets the alpha on all the cone
classitems.name: setAlpha

classitems.description: Moves the cone forward of one moveStep
classitems.name: moveForward

classitems.description: Moves the cone backwards of one moveStep
classitems.name: moveBack

classitems.description: Moves the cone left of one moveStep
classitems.name: moveLeft

classitems.description: Moves the cone right of one moveStep
classitems.name: moveRight

classitems.description: Turns the cone left of one turnStep
classitems.name: turnLeft

classitems.description: Turns the cone right of one turnStep
classitems.name: turnRight

classitems.description: Stops all the fx animations
classitems.name: stopAllAnimationsRunning

classitems.description: Stops eyes fx animation
classitems.name: stopWidenEyes

classitems.description: Reset eyes to orginal scale and position
classitems.name: resetWidenEyes

classitems.description: Stops cylinder fx animation
classitems.name: stopBump

classitems.description: Reset cylinder to orginal scale and position
classitems.name: resetBump

classitems.description: Moves the cone towards "point" of one moveStep
classitems.name: follow

params.name: callback
params.description: callback executed when the cone gets to point `function(point){}`

classitems.description:
This method is used internally to expose methods that are used both on Cone and Cone.List

You will use it when you make your own plugins to expose your own methods
classitems.name: addMethods

params.name: methodList
params.description: List of the methods to add to the cone list prototype

classitems.description:
Widens the eyes of the cone (and more)

Can also be run via the `.animate()` dispatcher
classitems.name: widenEyes

props.name: loop
props.description:
3 possibilities :
* `true` will loop the animation until you stop it
* `false` will play the animation only once
* a number will play the animation a number of times

props.name: callback
props.description: will run your callback at the end of the animation : `function(cone){}`

props.name: delay
props.description: Delay between the end of the animation and the execution of the callback (and potentionally the next animation in the queue)

props.name: break
props.description: If true cancels all animations in the queue before running this one

props.name: full
props.description: If true, runs the full animation (openning and closing eyes)

props.name: close
props.description: If true, runs only the close eyes part of the animation (by default, only opens eyes)

classitems.description:
Unwidens the eyes of the cone (and more)

Can also be run via the `.animate()` dispatcher
classitems.name: unWidenEyes

props.description: If true cancels all animations in the queue before running this one

props.name: full
props.description: If true, runs the full animation (openning and closing eyes)

props.name: close
props.description: If true, runs only the close eyes part of the animation (by default, does that on unWidenEyes)

classitems.description:
Let's your cone move to a position.

Can also be run via the `.animate()` dispatcher
classitems.name: moveTo

props.name: callback
props.description: will run your callback at the end of the animation : `function(cone){}`

props.name: delay
props.description: Delay between the end of the animation and the execution of the callback (and potentionally the next animation in the queue)

props.name: break
props.description: If true cancels all animations in the queue before running this one (`.moveTo()` is on the `move` queue, not the `fx` queue as the other animations, so you can run them in parallel of moveTo)

classitems.description:
Run any animate methods such as :

* animateAlpha
* animateScale
* bump
* fadeIn
* fadeOut
* unWidenEyes
* widenEyes
* moveTo

Just specify it in `options.method`. Those methods are also accessible directly via shorcuts on the {{#crossLink "Cone"}}Cone{{/crossLink}} instance.
classitems.name: animate
example:
```js
//you can use the .animate() dispatcher as well as the shortcuts, directly on a cone instance :
var myCone = new Cone(scene);
myCone
  .fadeOut()
  .fadeIn()
  .delay(1000)
  .widenEyes()
  .unWidenEyes()
  .then(function(next){myCone.setColor('#900000'); next()})
  .bump();
```

classitems.description: this method is inpired by http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5623838/rgb-to-hex-and-hex-to-rgb
classitems.name: hexToRgb

classitems.description:
Removes the animation from the mesh

returns true if the animation was removed / false if there was no animation to remove
classitems.name: removeAnimationFromMesh

classitems.description: Clone object (simple, not deep reccursive)
classitems.name: cloneObject

classitems.description:
Loops through the cone list providing a callback like `function(cone, index){}`

Return false in the callback to stop the loop
classitems.name: each

classitems.description:
Run any animate methods such as :

* animateAlpha
* animateScale
* bump
* fadeIn
* fadeOut
* unWidenEyes
* widenEyes
* moveTo

Just specify it in `options.method`. Those methods are also accessible via the same shortcuts like you would use on a {{#crossLink "Cone"}}Cone{{/crossLink}} instance.
classitems.name: animate

params.name: options
params.description: same options as the ones on the cone for each animation method

example:
```js
//you can use the .animate() dispatcher as well as the shortcuts, directly on a conelist :
var myConeList = new ConeList([myCone1,myCone2,myCone3]);
myConeList
  .fadeOut()
  .fadeIn()
  .delay(1000)
  .widenEyes()
  .unWidenEyes()
  .then(function(next){myConeList.setColor('#900000'); next()})
  .bump();
```

classitems.description:
This method is used internally to expose methods that are used both on Cone and Cone.List

You will use it when you make your own plugins to expose your own methods
classitems.name: addMethods

params.name: methodList
params.description: List of the methods to add to the cone list prototype
